verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities.
verses.web: When Jesus had finished directing his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and preach in their cities.
verses.ct: After Jesus finished giving instructions to his 12 disciples, he left that area to teach and preach in the surrounding cities.

verses.kjv: Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples,
verses.web: Now when John heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples
verses.ct: John the Baptist, who was in prison, heard about everything Christ was doing. So he sent 2 of his disciples

verses.kjv: And said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another?
verses.web: and said to him, “Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?”
verses.ct: to ask Jesus, "Are you the one we've been waiting for, or should we be looking for someone else?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto them, Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see:
verses.web: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John the things which you hear and see:
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "Go back and tell John what you're hearing and seeing for yourselves:

verses.kjv: The blind receive their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have the gospel preached to them.
verses.web: the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.
verses.ct: Blind people are receiving their sight. The lame are walking. Lepers are being healed. The deaf can hear. The dead are being raised to life. And the poor are hearing the good news.

verses.kjv: And blessed is he, whosoever shall not be offended in me.
verses.web: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”
verses.ct: Blessed is anyone who doesn't lose faith in me."

verses.kjv: And as they departed, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken with the wind?
verses.web: As these went their way, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.ct: As John's disciples were leaving, Jesus turned to the crowds and spoke about John. "When you went out into the wilderness, what did you expect to see? A blade of grass swaying in the wind?

verses.kjv: But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? behold, they that wear soft clothing are in kings’ houses.
verses.web: But what did you go out to see? A man in soft clothing? Behold, those who wear soft clothing are in kings’ houses.
verses.ct: No? Then what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? People who wear fine clothes live in palaces.

verses.kjv: But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? yea, I say unto you, and more than a prophet.
verses.web: But why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.
verses.ct: So what did you really go out to see? A prophet? Yes — and I tell you, he is far more than a prophet.

verses.kjv: For this is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
verses.web: For this is he, of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’
verses.ct: This is the one Scripture talks about when it says, 'Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare the way for you.'

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist: notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
verses.web: Most certainly I tell you, among those who are born of women there has not arisen anyone greater than John the Baptizer; yet he who is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: no one ever born has been greater than John the Baptist. And yet even the least important person in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he is.

verses.kjv: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force.
verses.web: From the days of John the Baptizer until now, the Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force.
verses.ct: From the time John the Baptist began preaching until now, the kingdom of heaven has been under violent assault, and forceful people try to seize it.

verses.kjv: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
verses.web: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
verses.ct: All the prophets and the Law pointed forward to what was coming — right up until John appeared.

verses.kjv: And if ye will receive it, this is Elias, which was for to come.
verses.web: If you are willing to receive it, this is Elijah, who is to come.
verses.ct: If you're willing to accept it, John is the Elijah who was prophesied to come.

verses.kjv: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.web: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.ct: If you have ears to hear, then listen carefully!

verses.kjv: But whereunto shall I liken this generation? It is like unto children sitting in the markets, and calling unto their fellows,
verses.web: “But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces, who call to their companions
verses.ct: "What can I compare this generation to? They're like children sitting in the marketplace, calling out to each other,

verses.kjv: And saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.
verses.web: and say, ‘We played the flute for you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned for you, and you didn’t lament.’
verses.ct: 'We played music for you, and you didn't dance! We sang funeral songs, and you didn't mourn!'

verses.kjv: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a devil.
verses.web: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’
verses.ct: John came fasting and avoiding wine, and people said, 'He has a demon.'

verses.kjv: The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold a man gluttonous, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners. But wisdom is justified of her children.
verses.web: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is justified by her children.”
verses.ct: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, 'Look at him — a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!' But wisdom proves itself right by what it produces."

verses.kjv: Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done, because they repented not:
verses.web: Then he began to denounce the cities in which most of his mighty works had been done, because they didn’t repent.
verses.ct: Then Jesus began to call out the cities where he had performed most of his miracles, because they still refused to repent.

verses.kjv: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works, which were done in you, had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.web: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.ct: "How terrible it will be for you, Chorazin! How terrible for you, Bethsaida! If the miracles I did in your streets had been done in Tyre and Sidon, those cities would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

verses.kjv: But I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment, than for you.
verses.web: But I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.
verses.ct: I tell you, on the day of judgment, Tyre and Sidon will be better off than you.

verses.kjv: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shalt be brought down to hell: for if the mighty works, which have been done in thee, had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.
verses.web: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, you will go down to Hades. For if the mighty works had been done in Sodom which were done in you, it would have remained until today.
verses.ct: And you, Capernaum — do you think you'll be lifted up to heaven? You'll be thrown down to hell. If the miracles done in you had been done in Sodom, that city would still be standing today.

verses.kjv: But I say unto you, That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.
verses.web: But I tell you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom, on the day of judgment, than for you.”
verses.ct: I tell you, on the day of judgment, even the land of Sodom will be better off than you."

verses.kjv: At that time Jesus answered and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes.
verses.web: At that time, Jesus answered, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants.
verses.ct: At that time, Jesus prayed, "I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and educated, and revealed them to those as trusting as little children.

verses.kjv: Even so, Father: for so it seemed good in thy sight.
verses.web: Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.
verses.ct: Yes, Father, this is exactly what pleased you.

verses.kjv: All things are delivered unto me of my Father: and no man knoweth the Son, but the Father; neither knoweth any man the Father, save the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son will reveal him.
verses.web: All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows the Son, except the Father; neither does anyone know the Father, except the Son, and he to whom the Son desires to reveal him.
verses.ct: My Father has entrusted everything to me. No one truly knows the Son except the Father, and no one truly knows the Father except the Son — and anyone the Son chooses to reveal him to."

verses.kjv: Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
verses.web: “Come to me, all you who labor and are heavily burdened, and I will give you rest.
verses.ct: "Come to me, all of you who are exhausted and weighed down with heavy burdens, and I will give you rest.

verses.kjv: Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.
verses.web: Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart; and you will find rest for your souls.
verses.ct: Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, because I am gentle and humble in heart. You will find rest for your souls.

verses.kjv: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.
verses.web: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.”
verses.ct: My yoke is easy, and my burden is light."
